learning: Building a complex fraction image generation app in Vanilla Javascript as a portfolio project that could have real users.
questions: What are the benefits and drawbacks of using HTML canvas verses SVG?

learning: Deploying a site and hooking it up a domain, marketing, setting up google analytics and Hotjar, analyzing user sessions and other data.

learning: Learned basics of React including state, useEffect, useContext, useRef and custom hooks, and Component API Design
questions: When do I need to use useEffect?
When do I need to use useRef?

learning: Practiced using React to build some more frontend mentor projects. Used useEffect incorrectly a bunch to get practice with it... and then learned being a good React developer is knowing when NOT to use useEffect and derive variables from state instead. Learned how to organize my state management with encapsulation by creating a context and exporting all functions that update that context along with the context itself.

questions: Is it okay to have three different puzzle piece components (depending on where they're located in the DOM) all visually pretending to be the same puzzle piece?
If so, how do I create the illusion that they're all the same illusion during and after drag and drop?
How do I maintain their rotated state without having them re-rotate when they move to a new place in the DOM?
How do I allow the boards and pieces to be generated dynamically from my levels.json?
How do I adjust the CSS of the board so it has the right border for any given board shape (with missing corners, inside, etc)?
How do I set the unit size for each level to fit on various screen sizes and to accommodate the various board dimensions and number of pieces?

learning: Full Stack Hackathon Project with React and Nest.JS on the backend. I taught and collaborated with another developer and a designer both of whom have never used React to write the frontend. Reviewing others code in a productive way, handling complex merge conflicts, collaborating with a backend team to read and write to a database, dealing with CORS errors.
questions: How should I give a code review to prevent regressions and ensure high quality?

What should be considered a branch?
Can I or should I collaborate with someone else on a branch?
How can Git features and continuous integration help with these challenges?

learning: Full Stack Solo Frontend Mentor Project with a Node and Express Backend. Also my first time using Tailwind.
questions: How does CORS work?
What's the point of CORS?

learning: Working on a 14 person team, giving and recieving code reviews. Writing unit, integration, and end to end tests.
questions: How do I decide what to test in component testing?
Where is the line between unit and integration testing? And integration and end to end testing?
How can we write tests behind a login screen that requires OAUTH (no username and password)?
How do I avoid testing the implementation details in component testing if the cause or effect occurs outside of that component?

learning: Frectangles Work Part 2. Figuring out UX of invalid puzzle piece states, keeping track of the board squares to detect overlaps, invalid positions, and whether the user has 'passed' the level. Refactoring my code for cleanliness and reusability.
questions: How should I handle piece overlaps in a way that's makes it clear that overlapping is not a valid solution while also not moving pieces unexpectedly?
How can I allow players to double and halve pieces that result in too long or too tall pieces but make it obvious that that's not a valid state?
How can I tease apart my state management so each context provider handles it's own state updates and one context provider cannot directly update the state of another?
How can I use component composition to have one ActionsToolbar component wrap around three different puzzle piece components and act as a controller for each of them?

How can I pass a ref to a parent component to allow my controller component to rotate each puzzle piece? (I ended up leaving the ref and rotation animation function in each individual puzzle piece component).
